main.description: I create custom solutions in JavaScript and Typescript, frequently leveraging technologies like React, Astro, and/or Next. I'm a wiz with Python, and enjoy tackling backend challenges pertaining to scalability, security, and functionality.

about.heading: About me
about.blurb: I'm a mom, partner, developer, voracious reader, and year-round grower of things.
about.professionalDesc: Professionally, I thrive on a diverse team of empathetic, creative, skilled devs, but also enjoy freelancing on my own, particularly when working with small local businesses.
about.personalDesc: Away from screens, I wrangle my toddler, play board games with my husband, care for our gardens and land, cook, and read.

portfolio.stayTuned: Currently building something fun for this space!
portfolio.heading: View my portfolio

contact.heading: Talk to me!
contact.freelance: I'm currently available for web development projects with small businesses.
contact.permanentFT: I'm also open to exploring a remote, full-time role with your team!

trivia.stayTuned: Something interactive coming to this space soon!

questions.question: I'm studying Italian to gain citizenship through marriage
questions.answer: True! My husband is applying through family ties, but as his spouse, I need to show intermediate proficiency in the language to qualify.

questions.question: Our toddler sings which song daily:
questions.answer: Jingle Bells! He started singing around 12 months of age, and this was the first recognizable long-form song he latched onto.

questions.question: In a past job, I was:
questions.answer: A mascot! Yup. A big kangaroo named K.O., mascot of the Brockton Rox (unaffiliated professional baseball team).

questions.question: You might not guess that I have solid ____ skills.
questions.answer: Trumpet! Prior to having our son, I played in a number of actively-gigging street bands around Greater Boston.

questions.question: My all-time favorite TV show is:
questions.answer: Real respect to Buffy, but The Office is my #1. It's incredible how funny and how quotable this show is. Dwight is one of my favorite fictional characters.

questions.question: The first concert I saw live was headlined by:
questions.answer: Third Eye Blind in Portland, ME! Openers were Our Lady Peace and Eve 6. I remember writing in my journal about how 3eb's lead singer had used 'the F word' a lot.
